attributes.action: Change the unique way by which public houses are assessed for business rates.
attributes.additional_details: To slow down the closures of public houses, current taxation policies are making ever-increasing numbers of public houses unviable.
attributes.background: Remove the Fair maintainable trade calculation.

rejection.details:
You appear to want the FMT removed Unclear but also want business rates changed; but by removing the FMT there is no way that any calculation can be done for business rate purposes 
The Government has announced some recent changes to its business rates proposal for pubs:
https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/cbp-10460/

You may wish to submit another petition suggesting how FMT might be replaced.

You may also wish to sign one of these petitions on the subject which are open:

Abolish business rates for UK pubs and hospitality businesses
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/754654

Cut VAT, Slash Beer Duty, reform business rates and cap energy costs for pubs
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734677
